org.epochx.tools.grammar
Class Grammar

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.tools.grammar.Grammar

public class Grammar
extends java.lang.Object

A grammar object is constructed from a BNF language grammar. In the grammar guided evolutionary approaches, a Grammar instance defines the valid syntax of a program's source being evolved. As well as defining the syntax of solutions, the grammar also essentially determines the function and terminal sets which are explicitly defined in tree GP.

A file or string containing a BNF grammar is parsed upon construction and a form of derivation tree with all possible options is created. The root of this tree is determined as the first rule in the grammar string and is retrieveable with a call to the getStartSymbol() method. The GrammarNode this method returns may be either a GrammarLiteral or a GrammarRule. Terminal symbols are represented as GrammarLiterals and simply consist of a string value which matches the string from the BNF grammar. It is these terminals that will form the source code of any program that uses it. Non-literals are represented as GrammarRules and each have a set of GrammarProductions. Each production describes a valid syntax for that non-terminal rule.

Productions can also be provided with attributes. Attributes are simply key/value pairs which are then stored in the resultant GrammarProduction instance. They provide a basic mechanism to implement semantic constraints such as those used in attribute grammars or to otherwise provide meta-data about a production, e.g. weights. The format to provide attributes is to include within the production a special grammar rule. The rule should begin and end with a question mark character '?'. Between those question marks a series of key/values, made up of the key and an equals character '=' followed by the value. Multiple key/values can be provided separated by a semi-colon ';' character.

An example rule:

<example-rule> ::= abc | cde | <ruleA> <ruleB>

Most of the features known as EBNF (extended BNF) are not currently supported.

Constructor Detail

Grammar

public Grammar(java.lang.String grammarStr)
        throws MalformedGrammarException
Constructs a Grammar with the given string as the BNF grammar to be parsed.

Parameters:
grammarStr - a String containing a BNF language grammar.
Throws:
MalformedGrammarException - if the given grammar string is not in a valid format.

Grammar

public Grammar(java.io.File grammarFile)
        throws java.io.IOException,
               MalformedGrammarException
Constructs a Grammar with the given file as a reference to a text file containing a BNF grammar, which will be read and parsed.

Parameters:
grammarFile - a File pointing to a text file containing a BNF language grammar.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem reading the file.
MalformedGrammarException - if the given grammar string is not in a valid format.
Method Detail

getStartRule

public GrammarRule getStartRule()
Returns the root of the grammar parse tree. This will always be a GrammarRule for a valid BNF grammar.

Returns:
the starting GrammarRule that is at the root of the grammar parse tree.

parseGrammar

protected void parseGrammar(java.lang.String grammar)
                     throws MalformedGrammarException
Throws:
MalformedGrammarException

isInfinitelyRecursive

protected boolean isInfinitelyRecursive(GrammarRule rule)
Determines whether the given GrammarRule is infinitely recursive. A rule is infinitely recursive if all its productions contain either a recursive reference to the rule, or a reference to another rule where all its productions contain such a reference to the rule.

Parameters:
rule - the rule to test for infinite recursion.
Returns:
true if the given rule is infinitely recursive, and false otherwise.

getGrammarLiterals

public java.util.List<GrammarLiteral> getGrammarLiterals()
Returns a list of the grammar's terminal symbols - the literal values.

Returns:
a complete list of the literals in this grammar.

getGrammarLiteral

public GrammarLiteral getGrammarLiteral(java.lang.String name)
Returns a specific terminal from this grammar, according to the name label of the symbol.

Parameters:
name - the label that refers to the grammar literal to return.
Returns:
the grammar terminal with the given name label, or null if a terminal with that name does not exist in the grammar.

getGrammarRules

public java.util.List<GrammarRule> getGrammarRules()
Returns a list of the grammar rules that make up this grammar.

Returns:
a complete list of the non-literals in this grammar.

getGrammarRule

public GrammarRule getGrammarRule(java.lang.String name)
Returns a specific GrammarRule from this grammar, according to the name label of the rule.

Parameters:
name - the label that refers to the grammar rule to return.
Returns:
the GrammarRule with the given name label, or null if rule with that name does not exist in the grammar.

getMinimumDepth

public int getMinimumDepth()
Returns the minimum depth of this grammr. The minimum depth of a grammar is equal to the minimum depth of its start symbol, which is the minimum depth required to resolve to only grammar literals.

Returns:
the minimum depth required by this grammar to resolve to only grammar literals.
